headline: Nvidia has largest short position by dollar value as risk exposure declines - S3
summary: Investing.com - NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) has become the largest short position by notional dollar value at $34.3 billion, according to research released Wednesday by S3 Partners, a technology-focused analytics firm, although by percentage of float, the short interest has declined in the AI powerhouse. Claiming the top spot in notional short is mainly related to Nvidia’s surging market capitalization, the report highlights.

headline: Tesla's full self-driving isn't prime-time ready: CFRA analyst
summary: Tesla (TSLA) stock was downgraded to Sell by CFRA's team over the disconnect between the EV stock's fundamentals and value. Shares of the EV developer are ticking higher after CEO Elon Musk bought $1 billion worth of stock earlier this week. CFRA analyst Garrett Nelson — the analyst behind the call — speaks further with Josh Lipton about his assessment of the electric vehicle company and shares his thoughts on Tesla's full self-driving business. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Fed Signals More Cuts, But Powell Says Don't Be Too Sure (Live Coverage)
summary: The Federal Reserve delivered its first interest-rate cut of the year on Wednesday and bolstered hopes for further rate cuts in October and December.  After the 2 p.m. ET policy statement, the S&P 500 traded fractionally higher in afternoon stock market action as Fed chief Jerome Powell painted a cautiously upbeat picture of where the economy stands.  What Wall Street really wanted to know was whether the Fed saw this as the first cut of a bunch or whether we could quickly be back in wait-and-see mode.

headline: Tesla Is Redesigning Door Handles That Drew Scrutiny Over Safety
summary: Franz von Holzhausen, Tesla’s longtime design chief, said the company is looking to combine the electronic and manual door-release mechanisms, which are currently in separate locations.  “The idea of combining the electronic one and the manual one together into one button, I think, makes a lot of sense,” he said Wednesday in an interview for Bloomberg’s  podcast.  Tesla’s handles have drawn attention after a Bloomberg News investigation this month uncovered a series of incidents in which people were injured or died after they were unable to open doors after a loss of power, particularly after crashes.

Tesla’s handles have drawn attention after a Bloomberg News investigation this month uncovered a series of incidents in which people were injured or died after they were unable to open doors after a loss of power, particularly after crashes.

headline: Car Stocks Race Higher After Fed Cuts Rates
summary: Shares of auto makers got a boost from the Fed rate decision.  General Motors and Ford Motor shares extended daily gains, leaving shares up 1.7% and 2%, respectively, shortly after the Fed’s decision to lower benchmark interest rates to a range of 4% to 4.25% from the prior range of 4.25% to 4.5%.  Coming into Wednesday trading, Tesla stock rose for six consecutive sessions, adding about 22% over that span.

Coming into Wednesday trading, Tesla stock rose for six consecutive sessions, adding about 22% over that span.

headline: Almost Everything Is Rallying Ahead of Fed Decision. What’s Not Matters More.
summary: The closest it got was on July 11, 2024 when the index fell 0.9% and 396 stocks gained, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  On that day, it was Tesla, Lam Research, Nvidia, Applied Materials, and Micron that dragged on the index.  This time around Broadcom, Palantir Technologies, and Nvidia were the among the big laggards, but Microsoft, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, Tesla, and Amazon.com were also dragging on the index.

headline: Fed Meeting: Rate-Cut Coming, But Watch Out For These 2 Words (Live Coverage)
summary: The Federal Reserve is set to deliver its first interest-rate cut after a nine-month pause, and markets have little doubt that it will be a quarter-point move.  Any surprise is likely to come from the rate cut's packaging — from the number of dissenting votes, to future interest-rate projections to the outlook Fed Chairman Jerome Powell offers at his post-meeting news conference.  What Wall Street really wants to know is whether the Fed sees this as the first cut of a bunch or whether we could quickly be back in wait-and-see mode.

headline: Waymo to offer autonomous rides in Nashville on Lyft ride-hailing network
summary: (Reuters) -Alphabet’s Waymo plans to start offering autonomous cab rides in Nashville next year in collaboration with ride-hailing firm Lyft, the two companies said.  Riders in the Music City will initially be able to hail self-driving cabs through the Waymo app.  As the service grows, riders will also be able to use the Lyft app to match with a Waymo vehicle, the companies said in a statement.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, Workday, Tesla, FedEx, General Mills, and More
summary: Stock futures were mixed Wednesday with Wall Street widely expecting the Federal Reserve to reduce a key interest rate by a quarter-point later in the trading session.  Nvidia  fell 1.3% after report from the Financial Times said China’s internet regulator had banned the country’s biggest tech companies from buying its artificial-intelligence chips.  The Cyberspace Administration of China told TikTok parent ByteDance and e-commerce giant  Alibaba  among others, to end testing and orders of Nvidia’s tailored-made products for China, the Financial Times reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

raw.headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, Workday, Tesla, FedEx, General Mills, and More
raw.summary: Stock futures were mixed Wednesday with Wall Street widely expecting the Federal Reserve to reduce a key interest rate by a quarter-point later in the trading session.  Nvidia  fell 1.3% after report from the Financial Times said China’s internet regulator had banned the country’s biggest tech companies from buying its artificial-intelligence chips.  The Cyberspace Administration of China told TikTok parent ByteDance and e-commerce giant  Alibaba  among others, to end testing and orders of Nvidia’s tailored-made products for China, the Financial Times reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline: Oracle Sparks Bubble Talk With Stock Price in Dot-Com Territory
summary: Shares of the database software company have soared 84% this year, the seventh-best performance in the S&P 500 Index, as scorching demand for AI computing turbocharges its revenue growth.  Oracle also has been linked to the Trump administration’s negotiations to keep TikTok operating in the US.  The company has served as TikTok’s primary cloud infrastructure provider for years.

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: The Fed’s in a Tight Spot
summary: The Dow industrials, S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite all fell, despite some decent gains by megacap names like Amazon, Meta and Tesla.  Suspense is building ahead of the Federal Reserve's interest-rate decision.  Stronger retail sales may complicate the case for numerous rate cuts if central bankers believe inflation is still a risk.

headline: Australia's Syrah Resources gets Tesla reprieve in graphite supply deal
summary: Elon Musk-led Tesla issued a default notice in July after Syrah allegedly failed to deliver conforming active anode material samples from its Louisiana processing facility for Tesla's EV batteries.  "While Syrah does not accept it is in default under the offtake agreement, the parties have extended the cure date to 15 November 2025," the company stated, adding that both sides are collaborating to resolve the dispute.

raw.headline: Australia's Syrah Resources gets Tesla reprieve in graphite supply deal
raw.summary: Elon Musk-led Tesla issued a default notice in July after Syrah allegedly failed to deliver conforming active anode material samples from its Louisiana processing facility for Tesla's EV batteries.  "While Syrah does not accept it is in default under the offtake agreement, the parties have extended the cure date to 15 November 2025," the company stated, adding that both sides are collaborating to resolve the dispute.

headline: Hong Kong’s Day Traders Chase Leveraged ETFs After US Tech Boom
summary: Leveraged exchange-traded funds, once the preserve of professional speculators given their ability to amplify both gains and losses, are gaining traction among retail investors in Hong Kong.  While some, like Miao, trade US-based products, a new rule allowing listings of amplified single-stock wagers in the city — a first in Asia — has made it easier to access turbocharged products tracking names at the heart of the US equity rally.  The wave of new launches reflects issuers responding to that demand: So far this year, more than a dozen new single-stock leveraged ETFs have launched in Hong Kong, data compiled by Bloomberg show, compared with just three linked to indexes in 2024 and none in 2023.

raw.headline: Hong Kong’s Day Traders Chase Leveraged ETFs After US Tech Boom
raw.summary: Leveraged exchange-traded funds, once the preserve of professional speculators given their ability to amplify both gains and losses, are gaining traction among retail investors in Hong Kong.  While some, like Miao, trade US-based products, a new rule allowing listings of amplified single-stock wagers in the city — a first in Asia — has made it easier to access turbocharged products tracking names at the heart of the US equity rally.  The wave of new launches reflects issuers responding to that demand: So far this year, more than a dozen new single-stock leveraged ETFs have launched in Hong Kong, data compiled by Bloomberg show, compared with just three linked to indexes in 2024 and none in 2023.
